what: What does the Patient Profile module do?
title: Patient Profile Module
text: DaVinci Patient Profile module displays patient information subject-level basis. divided three sections: summary, listings, plots. Summary: Snapshot patient’s demographic information doesn’t change visits. Listings: Information changes visit. Plots: Visual depictions events time, adverse events concomitant medication, point-like events like lab values vital sign measurements. following screenshot shows module configured display popular sample safetyData dataset. Notice three sections titles “Patient Information”, “Data Listings” “Graphical Display”:  next section breaks necessary configuration steps set display. final section shows resulting configuration.

what: How to configure the Patient Profile module?
title: Patient Profile Module
text: mod_patient_profile function takes several arguments, optional: module_id: unique identifier Shiny module DaVinci app. subject_level_dataset_name, subjid_var: subject-level dataset name unique subject identifier column respectively. sender_ids: optional parameter identifies modules can request display target patient IDs. can read dedicated “Module Communication” article. summary, listings, plots: optional parameters allow customize information displayed three section. Let’s take look separately.

title: Patient Profile Module
text: listings parameter named list elements include listings “Data Listing” section. Recall listings section sample image beginning article: parameterization generates section : Notice names list ("Concomitant Medication" "Adverse Events") used labels blue “Domain” selector. mandatory dataset field indicates domain display heading. optional default_vars initial selection “Columns” display listing. user can modify selection. bold-faced listing headings extracted label column attribute already present dataset.
code: listings = list(   "Concomitant Medication" = list(     dataset = "cm"   ),   "Adverse Events" = list(     dataset = "adae",     default_vars = c("ASTDT", "ASTDY", "AENDT", "AENDY", "AEDECOD", "AESEV")   ) )

previous_headings: How to configure the Patient Profile module?
title: Patient Profile Module
text: plots parameter named list elements include plots “Graphical Display” section. Recall plots section sample image beginning article:  parameterization generates section : two previous sections, clear mapping plot fields effect displayed charts. ’s brief summary fields: timeline_info configures extent horizontal time axis. range_plots value_plots describe plots include. vline_vars vline_day_numbers (optional used example) add extra vertical markers run plots. palette (optional used example) used fine-tune color points, ranges vertical markers plots. ’s detailed account properties:
code: plots = list(     timeline_info = c(trt_start_date = "TRTSDT", trt_end_date = "TRTEDT"),     range_plots = list(       "Concomitant Medication" = list(         dataset = "cm",         vars = c(start_date = "CMSTDT", end_date = "CMENDT", decode = "CMDECOD",                   grading = "CMDECOD"),         tooltip = c()       ),       "Adverse Events" = list(         dataset = "adae",         vars = c(start_date = "ASTDT", end_date = "AENDT", decode = "AEDECOD",                   grading = "AESEV", serious_ae = "AESER"),         tooltip = c("AE Start Day: " = "ASTDY", "AE End Day: " = "AENDY")       )     ),     value_plots = list(       "Lab Values" = list(         dataset = "lb",         vars = c(analysis_param = "PARAM", analysis_val = "AVAL", analysis_date = "ADT",                   analysis_indicator = "LBNRIND", range_low_limit = "A1LO", range_high_limit = "A1HI"),         tooltip = c()       )     ),     vline_vars = c("Informed Consent Date" = "RFICDT")   )

previous_headings: How to configure the Patient Profile module? > The plots parameter
title: Patient Profile Module
text: timeline_info field list date variables dataset specified subject_level_dataset_name parameter. two mandatory subfields : trt_start_date: Treatment Start Date, used also Day 1 Reference Date derive Study Day numbers. trt_end_date: Treatment End Date. two additional optional subfields: icf_date: Informed Consent Form signing Date. part_end_date: Participation End Date. usually envelop extend treatment start-end time range. Including expands horizontal time range plots.

previous_headings: How to configure the Patient Profile module? > The plots parameter
title: Patient Profile Module
text:
range_plots field named list elements include plots range-like events (adverse events, concomitant medications, etc.). three members: dataset: Dataset name pull information. vars: Variables interest event. index dataset: start_date end_date: Beginning end range. decode: Description event. grading: Intensity event. Used color-coding ranges. serious_ae: Marker serious adverse event. Overlays SAE legend top events require special attention. tooltip: Defines block text display hover information left edge range. specified named list dataset variable names. names list included literal text honor three basic HTML formatting elements: , <>,
. columns values refer populated value dataset relevant given row.

previous_headings: How to configure the Patient Profile module? > The plots parameter
title: Patient Profile Module
text:
value_plots field named list elements include plots value-like traces (lab measurements, vital signs, etc.). three members: dataset: Dataset name pull information. vars: Variables interest event. first three mandatory. index dataset: analysis_param: Variable describing parameter plot. analysis_val: Value associated time point. analysis_date: Date sample collection. analysis_indicator: Used color-coding marker plot. Usually indicates whether value inside outside range. range_low_limit: Lower limit range considered normal particular parameter. range_high_limit: Higher limit range considered normal particular parameter. summary_stats : variable supplements analysis_val useful datasets one measurement per analysis_date. point variable summarizes measurements single visit centrality calculation (mean, median, etc.). tooltip: Defines block text display hover information left edge range. specified named list dataset variable names. names list included literal text honor three basic HTML formatting elements: , <>,
. columns values refer populated value dataset relevant given row.

previous_headings: How to configure the Patient Profile module? > The plots parameter
title: Patient Profile Module
text: vline_vars field places vertical dashed lines days indicated dataset columns. indexes dataset subject_level_dataset_name expects values type integer, Date POSIXt.

previous_headings: How to configure the Patient Profile module? > The plots parameter
title: Patient Profile Module
text: vline_day_numbers field requires vector integers, representing CDISC (non-zero) Study Days. places vertical dashed lines positions corresponding days.

previous_headings: How to configure the Patient Profile module? > The plots parameter
title: Patient Profile Module
text: palette field requires named list colors. name list matches text plot element, associated color applied element. mapping takes precedence built-palette. contains either HTML (#xxxxxx) R color. example, desired color element tagged “Relevant” yellow another tagged “Irrelevant” gray, appropriate palette definition:

title: Patient Profile Module
text: promised, ’s configuration resulting aggregating previous steps:
code: dv.papo::mod_patient_profile(   module_id = "papo",   subject_level_dataset_name = "adsl",   subjid_var = "USUBJID",   summary = list(     vars = c("SUBJID", "SITEID", "ARM", "TRTSDT", "TRTEDT", "AGE", "RACE", "SEX", "BMIBL"),     column_count = 3L   ),   listings = list(     "Concomitant Medication" = list(       dataset = "cm"     ),     "Adverse Events" = list(       dataset = "adae",       default_vars = c("ASTDT", "ASTDY", "AENDT", "AENDY", "AEDECOD", "AESEV")     )   ),   plots = list(     timeline_info = c(       trt_start_date = "TRTSDT",       trt_end_date = "TRTEDT"     ),     range_plots = list(       "Concomitant Medication" = list(         dataset = "cm",         vars = c(           start_date = "CMSTDT",           end_date = "CMENDT",           decode = "CMDECOD",           grading = "CMDECOD"         ),         tooltip = c()       ),       "Adverse Events" = list(         dataset = "adae",         vars = c(           start_date = "ASTDT",           end_date = "AENDT",           decode = "AEDECOD",           grading = "AESEV",           serious_ae = "AESER"         ),         tooltip = c(           "AE Start Day: " = "ASTDY",           "AE End Day: " = "AENDY"         )       )     ),     value_plots = list(       "Lab Values" = list(         dataset = "lb",         vars = c(           analysis_param = "PARAM",           analysis_val = "AVAL",           analysis_date = "ADT",           analysis_indicator = "LBNRIND",           range_low_limit = "A1LO",           range_high_limit = "A1HI"         ),         tooltip = c()       )     ),     vline_vars = c(       "Informed Consent Date" = "RFICDT"     )   ) )

title: Communication with other DaVinci modules
text: Configuring mod_patient_profile communicate module usually involves setting two parameters, one two modules participating exchange. receiver end, sender_ids parameter lists identifiers modules Patient Profile listen . sender side, specifics may vary, provide example using dv.clinlines module.

title: Communication with other DaVinci modules
text: sketch portions code relevant establish communication Patient Profile Clinical Timelines modules: Notice Patient Profile can specify one module source “jumping” messages.
code: module_list <- list(   "Patient Profiles" = dv.papo::mod_patient_profile(     module_id = "mod1",     ..., # ommitted for brevity     sender_ids = c("mod2")   ),   "Clinical Timelines" = dv.clinlines::mod_clinical_timelines(     module_id = "mod2",     ..., # ommitted for brevity     receiver_id = "mod1"   ) )

title: dv.papo
text: DaVinci’s dv.papo module shows patient information subject-level basis. can produce listings well variety plots. include events time (adverse events, concomitant medications, …) point-like events (lab values, vital sign measurements, …). limited one data source, thus can handle data either ADAM, SDTM.  DaVinci modules can direct mod_patient_profile select display information associated particular subject ID. Patient Profile instructed, switches target subject ID takes focus application, effectively jumping patient profile display result simple user interaction, mouse click.

title: dv.papo
dv.papo
text: use dv.papo inside DaVinci app, add module module list. code shows example definition one-item module list. setup plots parameter produces plot showing Adverse Events.  See vignette("a00-papo") information use dv.papo dv.manager.
code: dataset_list <- list(   "demo" = dv.papo:::prep_safety_data(5),   "demo2" = dv.papo:::prep_safety_data(10) )  module_list <- list(   "Patient Profile" = dv.papo::mod_patient_profile(     module_id = "papo",     subject_level_dataset_name = "adsl",     subjid_var = "USUBJID",     summary = list(       vars = c("SUBJID", "SITEID", "ARM", "TRTSDT", "TRTEDT", "AGE", "RACE", "SEX", "BMIBL"),       column_count = 3L     ),     listings = list(       "Concomitant Medication" = list(         dataset = "cm"       ),       "Adverse Events" = list(         dataset = "adae",         default_vars = c("ASTDT", "ASTDY", "AENDT", "AENDY", "AEDECOD", "AESEV")       )     ),     plots = list(       timeline_info = c(trt_start_date = "TRTSDT", trt_end_date = "TRTEDT"),       range_plots = list(         "Adverse Events" = list(           dataset = "adae",           vars = c(             start_date = "ASTDT", end_date = "AENDT",             decode = "AEDECOD", grading = "AESEV", serious_ae = "AESER"           ),           tooltip = c("AE Start Day: " = "ASTDY", "AE End Day: " = "AENDY")         )       ),       value_plots = list(),       vline_vars = c("Informed Consent Date" = "RFICDT")     )   ) )  dv.manager::run_app(   data = dataset_list,   module_list = module_list,   filter_data = "adsl" )

title: Run an example for Patient profile integrated in the module manager — mock_with_mm_app
Patient Profile Module — mod_patient_profile
text: mod_patient_profile DaVinci Shiny module displays patient information subject-level basis. consists three sections: summary, listings plots. summary section shows visit-independent demographic information. listings section offers listings visit-dependent information. plots section displays charts events happen span time (adverse events, concomitant medications, ...) line plots point-like events (laboratory values, vital sign measurements). Show/hide usage example   follows sample call mod_patient_profile function. See main article package tutorial parameterize .  dv.papo::mod_patient_profile(   module_id = "papo",   subject_level_dataset_name = "adsl",   subjid_var = "USUBJID",   summary = list(     vars = c("SUBJID", "SITEID", "ARM", "TRTSDT", "TRTEDT", "AGE", "RACE", "SEX", "BMIBL"),     column_count = 3L   ),   listings = list(     "Concomitant Medication" = list(       dataset = "cm"     ),     "Adverse Events" = list(       dataset = "adae",       default_vars = c("ASTDT", "ASTDY", "AENDT", "AENDY", "AEDECOD", "AESEV")     )   ),   plots = list(     timeline_info = c(trt_start_date = "TRTSDT", trt_end_date = "TRTEDT"),     range_plots = list(       "Concomitant Medication" = list(         dataset = "cm",         vars = c(           start_date = "CMSTDT", end_date = "CMENDT",           decode = "CMDECOD", grading = "CMDECOD"         ),         tooltip = c()       ),       "Adverse Events" = list(         dataset = "adae",         vars = c(           start_date = "ASTDT", end_date = "AENDT", decode = "AEDECOD",           grading = "AESEV", serious_ae = "AESER"         ),         tooltip = c("AE Start Day: " = "ASTDY", "AE End Day: " = "AENDY")       )     ),     value_plots = list(       "Lab Values" = list(         dataset = "lb",         vars = c(           analysis_param = "PARAM", analysis_val = "AVAL", analysis_date = "ADT",           analysis_indicator = "LBNRIND", range_low_limit = "A1LO", range_high_limit = "A1HI"         ),         tooltip = c()       )     ),     vline_vars = c(       "Informed Consent Date" = "RFICDT"     )   ) )
code: dv.papo::mod_patient_profile(   module_id = "papo",   subject_level_dataset_name = "adsl",   subjid_var = "USUBJID",   summary = list(     vars = c("SUBJID", "SITEID", "ARM", "TRTSDT", "TRTEDT", "AGE", "RACE", "SEX", "BMIBL"),     column_count = 3L   ),   listings = list(     "Concomitant Medication" = list(       dataset = "cm"     ),     "Adverse Events" = list(       dataset = "adae",       default_vars = c("ASTDT", "ASTDY", "AENDT", "AENDY", "AEDECOD", "AESEV")     )   ),   plots = list(     timeline_info = c(trt_start_date = "TRTSDT", trt_end_date = "TRTEDT"),     range_plots = list(       "Concomitant Medication" = list(         dataset = "cm",         vars = c(           start_date = "CMSTDT", end_date = "CMENDT",           decode = "CMDECOD", grading = "CMDECOD"         ),         tooltip = c()       ),       "Adverse Events" = list(         dataset = "adae",         vars = c(           start_date = "ASTDT", end_date = "AENDT", decode = "AEDECOD",           grading = "AESEV", serious_ae = "AESER"         ),         tooltip = c("AE Start Day: " = "ASTDY", "AE End Day: " = "AENDY")       )     ),     value_plots = list(       "Lab Values" = list(         dataset = "lb",         vars = c(           analysis_param = "PARAM", analysis_val = "AVAL", analysis_date = "ADT",           analysis_indicator = "LBNRIND", range_low_limit = "A1LO", range_high_limit = "A1HI"         ),         tooltip = c()       )     ),     vline_vars = c(       "Informed Consent Date" = "RFICDT"     )   ) )

title: Patient Profile Module — mod_patient_profile
text:
module_id [character] Unique Shiny module identifier. subject_level_dataset_name [character] Subject-level dataset name. subjid_var [character] Unique subject identifier column. sender_ids [character(n)] (optional) Identifiers modules allowed request display target patient IDs. summary [list] (optional) Subject-level summary section. Composed : vars [character(n)] Values display summary section. Indexes dataset subject_level_dataset_name. column_count [integer] Column count summary section. listings [list(n)] (optional) Listings section. Composed : dataset [character] Dataset name. default_vars [character(n)] (optional) Default columns display. specified, first six columns selected default. Indexes dataset dataset. plots [list] (optional) Plot section. Composed : timeline_info [list] Start end study dates. Composed : icf_date [character] (optional) Informed Consent Form signing Date. Indexes dataset subject_level_dataset_name. Expects [Date|POSIXt] values. trt_start_date [character] Treatment Start Date, used also Day 1 Reference Date. Indexes dataset subject_level_dataset_name. Expects [Date|POSIXt] values. trt_end_date [character] Treatment End Date. Indexes dataset subject_level_dataset_name. Expects [Date|POSIXt] values. part_end_date [character] (optional) Participation End Date. Indexes dataset subject_level_dataset_name. Expects [Date|POSIXt] values. range_plots [list(n)] Plots range-like events (adverse events, concomitant medications, ...). Composed : dataset [character] Dataset name. vars [list] Variables interest event. Composed : start_date [character] Start date. Indexes dataset dataset. Expects [Date|POSIXt] values. end_date [character] End date. Indexes dataset dataset. Expects [Date|POSIXt] values. decode [character] Descriptive event label. Indexes dataset dataset. Expects [character|factor] values. grading [character] (optional) Degree event, used color-coding plot. Indexes dataset dataset. Expects [character|factor] values. serious_ae [character] (optional) Marker event seriousness, usually reserved adverse event datasets. Indexes dataset dataset. Expects [logical|"Y"/"N"] values. tooltip [character(n)] Block text display hover information left edge range. names list included literal text honor three basic HTML formatting elements: , <>,
). columns values refer populated value dataset relevant given row. Indexes dataset dataset. value_plots [list(n)] Plots value-like (lab measurements, vital signs, ...) traces. Composed : dataset [character] Dataset name. vars [list] Variables interest trace. Composed : analysis_param [character] Parameter. Indexes dataset dataset. Expects [character|factor] values. analysis_val [character] Value. Indexes dataset dataset. Expects [numeric] values. analysis_date [character] Date. Indexes dataset dataset. Expects [Date|POSIXt] values. analysis_indicator [character] (optional) Analysis reference range indicator. Indexes dataset dataset. Expects [character|factor] values. range_low_limit [character] (optional) Lower limit reference range. Indexes dataset dataset. Expects [numeric] values. range_high_limit [character] (optional) Upper limit reference range. Indexes dataset dataset. Expects [numeric] values. summary_stats [character] (optional) Additional value column summary statistics. Indexes dataset dataset. Expects [numeric] values. tooltip [character(n)] Block text display hover information point trace. names list included literal text honor three basic HTML formatting elements: , <>,
). columns values refer populated value dataset relevant given row. Indexes dataset dataset. vline_vars [character(n)] Place vertical dashed lines days indicated dataset columns. Indexes dataset subject_level_dataset_name. Expects [integer|Date|POSIXt] values. vline_day_numbers [integer(n)] (optional) Place vertical dashed lines days indicated parameter. Represents CDISC (non-zero) Study Day. palette [character(n)] (optional) name list matches text plot element, associated color applied element. mapping takes precedence built-palette. Contains either HTML (#xxxxxx) R color.

Expects [Date|POSIXt] values. range_plots [list(n)] Plots range-like events (adverse events, concomitant medications, ...). Expects [Date|POSIXt] values. end_date [character] End date. Indexes dataset dataset. Expects [Date|POSIXt] values. decode [character] Descriptive event label. Indexes dataset dataset. Expects [character|factor] values. grading [character] (optional) Degree event, used color-coding plot. Indexes dataset dataset. Expects [character|factor] values. serious_ae [character] (optional) Marker event seriousness, usually reserved adverse event datasets. Indexes dataset dataset. Expects [logical|"Y"/"N"] values. tooltip [character(n)] Block text display hover information left edge range. names list included literal text honor three basic HTML formatting elements: , <>,
). columns values refer populated value dataset relevant given row. Indexes dataset dataset. value_plots [list(n)] Plots value-like (lab measurements, vital signs, ...) traces. Composed : dataset [character] Dataset name. vars [list] Variables interest trace. Composed : analysis_param [character] Parameter. Indexes dataset dataset. Expects [character|factor] values. analysis_val [character] Value. Indexes dataset dataset. Expects [numeric] values. analysis_date [character] Date. Indexes dataset dataset. Expects [Date|POSIXt] values. analysis_indicator [character] (optional) Analysis reference range indicator. Indexes dataset dataset. ). columns values refer populated value dataset relevant given row. Indexes dataset dataset. vline_vars [character(n)] Place vertical dashed lines days indicated dataset columns. Indexes dataset subject_level_dataset_name. Expects [integer|Date|POSIXt] values. vline_day_numbers [integer(n)] (optional) Place vertical dashed lines days indicated parameter. Represents CDISC (non-zero) Study Day. palette [character(n)] (optional) name list matches text plot element, associated color applied element. mapping takes precedence built-palette. Contains either HTML (#xxxxxx) R color.

title: Build a collection of named constants — pack_of_constants
Build a collection of named constants — pack_of_constants
text: ... Named parameters collected constants

title: Build a collection of named constants — pack_of_constants
text: Shiny uses strings IDs link UI server elements. E.g: foo_UI(id = ns("foo")) ... foo_server(id = "foo") pattern makes easy programmers fall trap modifying one instance string literal "foo" without modifying rest unaware problem bug hit. also easy mistakes uses "foo" identifier uses (text labels, ...) , often case, parameter explicitly named. One easy fix consists using global variables instead plain string literals. case previous example, mean: ID_FOO <- "foo" foo_UI(ns(ID_FOO)) ... foo_server(ID_FOO) simple addition makes purpose ID_FOO clear also fails gracefully ID_FOO instances updated synchronously along codebase. drawback polluting global namespace identifier variables. easily solved creating container constants, purpose pack_of_constants alias. ID <- pack_of_constants(FOO = "foo", BAR = "bar") ID$FOO "foo" ID$BA Error $.pack_of_constants(ID, BA) : Pack constants "ID" contain "BA" pack constants plain named list enforces elements unique, non-null names. tagged S3 object override extraction operators. use checkmate unnecessary, Good Library(TM) module rely anyways

title: dv.papo 2.0.1
text: Fixes failed first interaction participant selected another module Fixes plotly version, previous version numbers failed obscure error Fixes legend removal grading present plots

title: dv.papo 2.0.0
text: name subject-level dataset now explicitly provided subject_level_dataset_name parameter. key renamed subjid_var. pt_info now called summary simplified. allows specify single dataframe select columns. row_item submember renamed column_count. tables now called listings named list pairs dataset default_vars. allows control columns shown default dataset. legacy basic_info, vlines plots now collected single plots parameter. restructured clarity also accompanied palette field makes possible caller specify individual colors. See main vignette information. parameters referring Study Days reframed point absolute days. ensures consistency time axis plots. module now accepts datetimes well dates easier joint configuration dv.clinlines. “time” part datetimes simply discarded. Configuration helper functions removed favor documentation templates. jumping_vars now called sender_ids consistency across davinci modules. Makes main three sections (summary, listings plots) optional, facilitates base working configuration. Provides clear start-warnings messages module misconfigured respect input datasets. app creator can safely assume message appears, module misbehave interacted due misconfiguration. remaining error rests solely module developer’s shoulders platform provider. Day labels now follow standard CDISC behavior skipping day 0 plots (day 1 refers Treatment Start Date; day -1 day ). Vertical lines now cross plots.
